com.google.template.soy.parsepasses.contextautoesc

Class Context

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.template.soy.parsepasses.contextautoesc.Context

  • public final class Context
extends Object
    Encapsulates the context in which a Soy node appears. This helps us distinguish Soy nodes that can only be preceded by fully formed HTML tags and text chunks from ones that appear inside JavaScript, from ones that appear inside URIs, etc.

    This is an immutable bit-packable struct that contains a number of enums. These enums have their own nullish values like Context.ElementType.NONE so should always be non-null.

    The contextual autoescape rewriter propagates contexts so that it can infer an appropriate escaping function for each {print ...} command.

    To make sure it can correctly identify a unique escape convention for all paths to a particular print command, it may clone a template for each context in which it is called, using the bitpacked form of the context to generate a unique template name.

      A state in the parse of an HTML document.

      Describes the part of a URI reference that the context point is in.

    • Field Detail

      • state

        public final Context.State state
        The state the text preceding the context point describes.

      • elType

        public final Context.ElementType elType
        Describes the innermost element that the text preceding the context point is in. An element is considered entered once its name has been seen in the start tag and is considered closed once the name of its end tag is seen. E.g. the open point is marked with O below and C marks the close point. <b id="boldly-going">Hello, World!</b > ^ ^ O C Outside an element, or in PCDATA text, this will be the nullish value Context.ElementType.NONE.

      • attrType

        public final Context.AttributeType attrType
        Describes the attribute whose value the context point is in. Outside an attribute value, this will be the nullish value Context.AttributeType.NONE.

      • delimType

        public final Context.AttributeEndDelimiter delimType
        Describes the quoting convention for the attribute value that the context point is in. Outside an attribute value, this will be the nullish value Context.AttributeEndDelimiter.NONE.

      • slashType

        public final Context.JsFollowingSlash slashType
        Determines what we will do with a slash token /. This is irrelevant outside JavaScript contexts, but inside JavaScript, it helps us distinguish the contexts of {$bar} in "foo".replace(/{$bar}/i) and x/{$bar}/i

      • uriPart

        public final Context.UriPart uriPart
        Determines how we encode interpolations in URI attributes and CSS uri(...).

      • templateNestDepth

        public final int templateNestDepth
        The count of <template> elements entered and not subsequently exited.

      • HTML_PCDATA

        public static final Context HTML_PCDATA
        The normal context for HTML where a less than opens a tag and an ampersand starts an HTML entity.

    • Method Detail

      • derive

        public Context derive(Context.State state)
        Returns a context that differs only in the state.

      • derive

        public Context derive(Context.JsFollowingSlash slashType)
        Returns a context that differs only in the following slash.

      • derive

        public Context derive(Context.UriPart uriPart)
        Returns a context that differs only in the uri part.

      • getContextAfterEscaping

        public Context getContextAfterEscaping(EscapingMode mode)
        The context reached after escaping content using the given mode from this context. This makes an optimistic assumption that the escaped string is not empty, but in practice this makes little difference, except Context.UriPart.START and subsequent states, but it is the wildcard state Context.UriPart.MAYBE_VARIABLE_SCHEME.

      • getEscapingModes

        public com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<EscapingMode> getEscapingModes()
        Returns the escaping mode appropriate for dynamic content inserted in this context.
        Returns:
        Empty if there is no appropriate escaping convention to use, e.g. for comments which do not have escaping conventions.

      • isCompatibleWith

        public boolean isCompatibleWith(EscapingMode mode)
        True if the given escaping mode could make sense in this context.

      • equals

        @Deprecated
public boolean equals(Object o)
        Deprecated. Prefer comparing states or predicates like isValidEndContext
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object

      • packedBits

        public int packedBits()
        An integer form that uniquely identifies this context. This form is not guaranteed to be stable across versions, so do not use as a long-lived serialized form.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • getStartContextForContentKind

        public static Context getStartContextForContentKind(SanitizedContent.ContentKind contentKind)
        Returns the autoescape Context that produces sanitized content of the given SanitizedContent.ContentKind.

        Given a SanitizedContent.ContentKind, returns the corresponding Context such that contextual autoescaping of a block of Soy code with that context as the start context results in a value that adheres to the contract of SanitizedContent of the given kind.

      • isValidStartContextForContentKind

        public boolean isValidStartContextForContentKind(SanitizedContent.ContentKind contentKind)
        Determines whether a particular context is valid at the start of a block of a particular content kind.

      • isValidStartContextForContentKindLoose

        public boolean isValidStartContextForContentKindLoose(SanitizedContent.ContentKind contentKind)
        Determines whether a particular context is allowed for contextual to strict calls.

        This is slightly more relaxed, and used to help piecemeal transition of templates from contextual to strict.

      • getMostAppropriateContentKind

        public SanitizedContent.ContentKind getMostAppropriateContentKind()
        Returns the most sensible content kind for a context.

        This is primarily for error messages, indicating to the user what content kind can be used to mostly null out the escaping. Returns TEXT if no useful match was detected.

      • isValidEndContextForContentKind

        public final boolean isValidEndContextForContentKind(SanitizedContent.ContentKind contentKind)
        Determines whether a particular context is valid for the end of a block of a particular content kind.

      • getLikelyEndContextMismatchCause

        public final String getLikelyEndContextMismatchCause(SanitizedContent.ContentKind contentKind)
        Returns a plausible human-readable description of a context mismatch;

        This assumes that the provided context is an invalid end context for the particular content kind.
